Key Match Events: Shreyas Iyer and KL Rahul hit hundreds as the duo forged a 208-run partnership – the highest fourth-wicket stand in World Cups.
India scored 126 runs in their final 10 overs to post the third total above 400 in the event.
Rahul needed only 62 balls for his hundred, getting there with two huge sixes in the last over that took India past 400.
Post-Match Reflections: Sharma, the India captain, said, 'Since we started the tournament it was always about taking one game at a time and playing that game well.'
Iyer said, 'My last few innings have given me a lot of confidence. It wasn’t an easy wicket to start on, it was playing tacky, a bit two-paced so I knew I had to make the most of a good start.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: KL Rahul scored an unbeaten 102 off 62 balls
Shreyas Iyer scored 128 not out in 84 balls
Netherlands were dismissed for 250 in 47.5 overs
Mohammed Siraj overcame a throat injury to contribute two wickets for 29 runs
Kuldeep Yadav took two wickets for 41 runs
Jasprit Bumrah took two wickets for 33 runs
Ravindra Jadeja took two wickets for 49 runs
